description.narrative: 1. Develop a working relationship between staff at UKATC, interested UK astronomers, staff at Tech University of Kenya and Kenyatta University and South African Astronomical Observatory 2. Define the goals for the 3 workshops on gathering the evidence base for an optical astronomical observatory in Kenya 3. During the workshops look at The astronomy research programmes that can be carried out given the location of the observatory and the likely aperture that can be afforded/is suitable for a new observatory Produce requirements on the hardware and associated control and data gathering software of the components of the observatory - telescope, instruments, control, data handling and other associated infrastructure Explore ways in which the observatory can be used to promote economic development in areas outwith the direct benefit to the university researchers and students 4 Run a teacher workshop to show how astronomy and the observatory can be used in the classroom to foster an interest in science 5 Produce a prospectus for the observatory to be used to attract partners and funding 6 Evaluate the ways in which above activities are carried out and how well they achieve the goal of demonstrating the benefits within sustainability development goals

We will be working with colleagues in Kenya and South Africa to look at the ways in which a new optical astronomical observatory in Kenya can act as a catalyst to help develop an interest in STEM (Science Technology Engineering and Medicine) subjects and careers while at the same time providing astronomers in Kenya with a research facility that can be used by staff and students. An observatory can also provide a focus for developing new expertise in technology companies in Kenya by working with researchers to build instruments and observatory infrastructure. This will be done during 3 workshops where experience and expertise will be shared and a prospectus for an observatory drwn up
